text:
Corte Madera (; formerly Adams) is an incorporated town in Marin County, California, United States. The population was 9,253 at the 2010 census.
Corte Madera is about south of San Rafael.
In Spanish, Corte Madera means "chopped wood". The area was famous for producing lumber out of redwood trees which went into the construction of the city of San Francisco.
